result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Keith Everton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
*DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

superMiscConds.notes: *Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

*Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment.
*Take all medications as prescribed.

*AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
*Absolute Sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian Keith Everton in court with Attorney Robert Buckett.  Defendant Brian Keith Everton in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State plays video in court from the police car dash camera.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  40 months with 275  days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  16 months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  24 months.  

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Take all medications as prescribed
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  No illegal drugs
-  Full-time employment
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Clerk:  jms

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Judge McAdams for Judge Sanders:

Defendant Brian Keith Everton in court with Attorney Robert Buckett.  Defendant Brian Keith Everton in custody.  Daniel j Gabler, appearing for Francesco Mineo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties in court for sentencing.
State requests the Court view a video prior to sentencing.

Defense counsel informs Court that defendant is requesting sentencing before Judge Sanders.  Court will grant request and orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brian Keith Everton in court with Attorney Robert Buckett; defendant Brian Keith Everton in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski, appearing for Francesco Mineo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored. 

PSI not ordered.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.  Bail conditions continue as previously set.  Jury trial is vacated.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Brian Keith Everton in court with Attorney Robert Buckett.  Defendant Brian Keith Everton in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case cannot proceed to plea and sentencing this morning due to court calendar congestion.
Court orders case passed to the afternoon.
Clerk:  jms

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

  Plea date scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert Buckett in court, defendant Brian Keith Everton not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case could not be heard on today's date as court is in trial on an unrelated case.  Defense counsel informs that he may not be entering a motion to withdraw.
Case adjourned for plea hearing/final pre-trial in Branch 28.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial until the next court date.
Clerk:  jms

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

  Hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian Keith Everton in court with Attorney Robert Buckett.  Defendant Brian Keith Everton in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel informs Court that defendant may want to proceed with other counsel.
Court holds colloquy with defendant and defers ruling until the next court date.
Court orders case adjourned for hearing/further final pre-trial in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Robert W. Buckett in court, defendant Brian Keith Everton not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant now wants a Jury Trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Robert W. Buckett in court, defendant Brian Keith Everton not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  FILE NOT IN COURT.  Attorney has to go over packet of discovery with his client.  Matter adjourned for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert W. Buckett in court, defendant Brian Keith Everton not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Status of counsel conducted.  Matter to remain calendared for plea and sentencing on 9/21/15.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not produced from the House of Corrections.   Defense motion to withdraw heard and granted.  Matter set for Status of Conference.  Defendant to be produced for this date.  Status conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Email received from Attorney Jeff Carpenter.  His client wants a new attorney.  Matter set for 8/25/15 @ 8:30 for Motion to Withdraw.  Attorney Carpenter and ADA Mineo notified of this date.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Brian Keith Everton not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to Court's congested calendar, matter rescheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Brian Keith Everton not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request an adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Brian Keith Everton not in court, in custody.  
Jeremy R. Arn for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Bail hearing and scheduling conference.  Hearing proceeded.  Appearance of the defendant waived for the purpose of todays proceedings.  Bail motion by defense argued; objected to by defense, and denied by the Court.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian Keith Everton in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Brian Keith Everton in custody.  Ronald Dague for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brian Keith Everton in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Brian Keith Everton in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
